channel.title: tools on Embrace The Red
channel.description: Recent content in tools on Embrace The Red

item.title: ASCII Smuggler - Improvements
item.description: I added a couple of features and improvements to ASCII Smuggler, including: Optional rendering of the BEGIN and END Unicode Tags when crafting hidden text Added a feature to URL decode the input before checking for hidden text Output Modes for Decoding: Switch between highlighting the hidden text amongst the regular content, or only showing the hidden text in the output The selected options are remembered now (using local storage) Updated the UI to make it look nicer (e.

item.title: Using procdump on Linux to dump credentials
item.description: I like using procdump on Windows. It’s quite handy for software development when systems have memory leaks or performance issues, procdump allows to set thresholds to trigger creation of a core dump. BUT, it’s also super useful to search processes for secrets and other information. For instance, this one liner will dump the memory of all processes to hard disk and then you can search them as you see fit.

item.title: The Silver Searcher - search through code and files quickly
item.description: In this very short post I wanna talk mention The Silver Searcher, which I just learned about a few weeks ago. In the past I have written quite a bit about the importance of credential hunting for your organization and some cool built-in operating system indexing features that can be used as well. Of course grep and findstr are also in every red teamers toolbox. As part of a coding project I recently learned about “The Silver Searcher”, which is very fast and has some neat features built it.
